channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The yellow lines are hardly visible, 16th December
item.description:
Yellow lines from Meadway to Albermarle Road are faded, and people are parking on the corner, which may result in fines because they are parking on the lines. It is also difficult to see oncoming traffic when turning left out of Meadway. The lines need to be repainted.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albemarle Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside the bin place, 16th December
item.description:
The bin room has been locked and everyone has placed their rubbish outside attracting rodent and smelling up the whole road

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Coventry Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load (Estates)

item.title: Easy access for homeless and drug dealers, 16th December
item.description:
The street lighting will be missing caused buy homeless and drug dealers. The love darkness and special around the area. Therefore, please repay It as soon as possible. They are also aggressive when it is dark...............hopefully tomorrow

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sidworth Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Street Light - Equipment damaged, pole leaning

item.title: Drain without a cover on has you drive in from Princess alice right hand side, 16th December
item.description:
This has been like this for month's now and needs to get fixed a.s.a.p it is very dangerous specially at night time when its dark... nobody can see it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Western Way, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unauthorised union and st george's flags, 16th December
item.description:
Last few weeks, there have been union and st george's flags affixed by zipties on street lamps in this very heavily jewish area. These need to be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Golders Green Road, Brent Cross, Greater London

item.title: Continuous cases of dog waste spilling onto pavement, 16th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chatterton Road, Southborough, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned lorry on pavement obscuring junction, 16th December
item.description:
Big lorry has been abandoned on the pavement at the junction of frobisher road and manor road. It is obscuring the junction so cannot see oncoming traffic. It's been there for a week and has many parking tickets on it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mariners Walk, Slade Green, Greater London

item.title: Missed paper bin collection, 16th December
item.description:
Missed communal paper bin. The bin is now full and this needs to be sorted before Christmas as it will mean lots of cardboard will be dumped in the car park
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frobisher Road, Slade Green, Greater London

item.title: No right turn sign not obvious, 16th December
item.description:
This is becoming dangerous for me and my child in buggy to cross the street. The no right turn sign is constantly ignored and needs making more obvious
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leigham Court Road, Streatham Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wheel damagingly deep pothole, Shooters Hill, 16th December
item.description:
Shooters Hill, westbound, in the vicinity of Eaglesfield Road; very deep pot hole, probably bigger than a large dinner plate across. Deep enough to do damage. Very dangerous for filtering two-wheelers, it's just where they ride.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shooters Hill, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hygiene Health & Safety & Fly-tipping issue, 16th December
item.description:
There has been a significant increase in fly-tipping in the Bin-Store located between Clarence Road & Greenwich Quay. "Bin Store Users" are also failing to secure their rubbish in the bins /skips - therefore Foxes have full access to their rubbish which is being spread across the local area. This is causing a Hygiene Health & Safety issue for local residents and acts to perpetuate the Fox defecation and hygiene issues experienced in this area.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Creek Road, Deptford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Metre long pothole, 6" deep in Danson underpass, 16th December
item.description:
There is a pothole approximately 1 metre long, 6" deep and a foot wide in Danson underpass, southbound, as you go under the bridge. It's in the middle of the southbound carriageway. Hard to see as you are just coming into the shadow of the A2 when you hit it. VERY dangerous for two wheelers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Underpass, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
